content: achieve your desired fit to modify sleeve length you can either add another row of decreases which will make the cu cid 431 a little tighter or do decrease every 7 row instead of 6 to gain an extra 1 25 in the sleeve pattern begins here collar- using the long tail cast on method c/o 80 stitches on 4 5 mm needles on the smaller cable with only the bulky yarn place a bor marker and join in the round and knit in 1x1 rib for one round with a single strand start the next round by adding the second strand then continue to work in 1x1 ribbing holding double work collar until the ribbing measures 2 5 work one round of stockinette with the 4 5mm needles while placing raglan markers k13 place m1 k14 place m2 k26 place m3 k14 place m4 k13 to return to the bor neckline shaping- now you will work the german short row to shape the neck change your needle tips to 6 5mm and transfer to the larger cable when needed round 1- k to 2 stitches before m1 m1r k2 slip marker k2 m1l k to 2 stitches before m2 m1r k2 slip marker k2 m1l k2 turn 3 round 2- p to bor slipping markers as you work them p to 2 stitches before m4 m1lp p2 slip marker p2 m1rp p to 2 stitches before m3 m1lp p2 slip marker p2 m1rp p2 turn round 3- k to bor slipping markers as you work them work this round as you did in round 1 working your double stitch then k2 turn round 4- p to bor slipping markers as you work them work this round as you did in round 2 working your double stitch then p2 turn round 5- work this round as you did round 3 round 6- work this round as you did round 4 after the last turn k to the bor yoke- continue working in the round to shape and create the yoke round 1- k to 2 stitches before m1 m1r k2 slip marker k2 m1l repeat raglan increases at each marker the same way round 2- k all stitches slipping markers as you work them repeat rounds 1 and 2 until the yoke measures 12 along the raglan seam or until desired depth next round- k to m1 remove marker k2 turn and work the wrong side by p to m4 remove marker p2 work flat across the back in stockinette for 4 row total to make the neckline higher and create more ease splitting for sleeves- k to end of the back section then place sleeve stitches on an extra cable or scrap yarn stopping 2 stitches before m2 using backwards loop method c/o 12 underarm stitches k the front section to m3 remove marker k2 place sleeve stitches on an extra cable or scrap yarn stopping 2 stitches before m4 using backwards loop method c/o 12 underarm stitches k
